DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to better understand communication between patients with lung cancer and their doctors. The investigators are also interested in patient's perceptions of the quality of communication with his/her doctor and how these perceptions may impact patient outcomes. The doctor is participating in this study and has given us permission to approach his/her eligible patients for study participation.
DOC.brief_title: Doctor-Patient Communication in Lung Cancer Care
DOC.criteria: Patients with confirmed lung cancer diagnosis or mass suspicious of lung cancer seen at MSK within past 03 months at time of consent as per clinician report and/or EMR Lung cancer treatment plan at MSK to include surgery, chemotherapy, radiation and/or immunotherapy within three months of the time of consent Participating physician approves his/her patient's participation in this study per physician report. Former (at least 100 cigarettes in lifetime and quit more than 30 days prior to enrollment) or current smoker (lifetime smoker who reports cigarette smoking within the past 30 days) as per self report or EMR; English fluency (determined through EMR or clinician report), as we do not have the resources to translate the consultations from other languages or the surveys to other languages; Patients must 18 years old or older Physician An MSK attending physician (radiologists, medical oncologists, and surgeons), who is a member of the Thoracic Disease Management Team currently treating thoracic patients at MSK as per self report Patient unable to comply with study procedures as determined by principal investigator. Physician Inclusion on protocol facepage (e.g., Bernard Park, MD)
